  • Clinical medicinal products

Fragmin single-dose syringes

  • Indications and doses

Indications and doses

Prophylaxis of deep-vein thrombosis in surgical patients—moderate risk,

By subcutaneous injection

  • For adults
    Initially 2500 units for 1 dose, dose to be given 1–2 hours before surgery, then 2500 units every 24 hours.

Prophylaxis of deep-vein thrombosis in surgical patients—high risk,

By subcutaneous injection

  • For adults
    Initially 2500 units for 1 dose, dose to be administered 1–2 hours before surgery, followed by 2500 units after 8–12 hours, then 5000 units every 24 hours, alternatively initially 5000 units for 1 dose, dose to be given on the evening before surgery, followed by 5000 units after 24 hours, then 5000 units every 24 hours.

Prophylaxis of deep-vein thrombosis in medical patients,

By subcutaneous injection

  • For adults
    5000 units every 24 hours.

Treatment of deep-vein thrombosis, with oral anticoagulant treatment, Treatment of pulmonary embolism, with oral anticoagulant treatment,

By subcutaneous injection

  • For adults (body-weight up to 45 kg)
    7500 units daily until adequate oral anticoagulation established.
  • For adults (body-weight 46–56 kg)
    10 000 units daily until adequate oral anticoagulation established.
  • For adults (body-weight 57–68 kg)
    12 500 units daily until adequate oral anticoagulation established.
  • For adults (body-weight 69–82 kg)
    15 000 units daily until adequate oral anticoagulation established.
  • For adults (body-weight 83 kg and above)
    18 000 units daily until adequate oral anticoagulation established.

Extended treatment and prophylaxis of venous thromboembolism in patients with solid tumours,

By subcutaneous injection

  • For adults (body-weight 40–45 kg)
    7500 units once daily for 30 days, then 7500 units once daily for a further 5 months, interrupt treatment or reduce dose in chemotherapy-induced thrombocytopenia—consult product literature.
  • For adults (body-weight 46–56 kg)
    10 000 units once daily for 30 days, then 7500 units once daily for a further 5 months, interrupt treatment or reduce dose in chemotherapy-induced thrombocytopenia—consult product literature.
  • For adults (body-weight 57–68 kg)
    12 500 units once daily for 30 days, then 10 000 units once daily for a further 5 months, interrupt treatment or reduce dose in chemotherapy-induced thrombocytopenia—consult product literature.
  • For adults (body-weight 69–82 kg)
    15 000 units once daily for 30 days, then 12 500 units once daily for a further 5 months, interrupt treatment or reduce dose in chemotherapy-induced thrombocytopenia—consult product literature.
  • For adults (body-weight 83–98 kg)
    18 000 units once daily for 30 days, then 15 000 units once daily for a further 5 months, interrupt treatment or reduce dose in chemotherapy-induced thrombocytopenia—consult product literature.
  • For adults (body-weight 99 kg and above)
    18 000 units once daily for 30 days, then 18 000 units once daily for a further 5 months, interrupt treatment or reduce dose in chemotherapy-induced thrombocytopenia—consult product literature.

Treatment of venous thromboembolism in pregnancy,

By subcutaneous injection

  • For adults (body-weight up to 49 kg)
    5000 units twice daily, use body-weight in early pregnancy to calculate the dose.
  • For adults (body-weight 50–69 kg)
    6000 units twice daily, use body-weight in early pregnancy to calculate the dose.
  • For adults (body-weight 70–89 kg)
    8000 units twice daily, use body-weight in early pregnancy to calculate the dose.
  • For adults (body-weight 90 kg and above)
    10 000 units twice daily, use body-weight in early pregnancy to calculate the dose.
